results.title: Dangerous Reef
results.brief_description: Social behavior and breeding of Australian sea lions in a small colony on Dangerous Reef Island in Spencer Gulf, South Australia.

results.title: Dangerous noise: listen while you can
results.creator_credit: Stewart Hardy Films and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: To persuade a man that he may be incurably damaging his ears, this film adopts the philosophy that he learns best what he also understands. The physics of sound - sound waves and frequency, pitch and loudness are introduced. The film demonstrates how the ear receives the sounds and compares actual test results showing damage done to the ears by dangerous noises.

results.title: Dangerous liaisons
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Lorimar Film Entertainment, NFH Films, Norma Heyman, Hank Moonjean and Stephen Frears
results.brief_description: Valmont (John Malkovich) can’t resist. Wealthy, alluring Merteuil (Glenn Close) has challenged him to seduce the beautiful and very proper Madame de Tourvel (Michelle Pfeiffer), a task involving Valmont’s favourite pastimes, love and revenge. What’s more, Merteuil offers herself as the ultimate prize. So let the game begin. The unspoken rules to this contest of sinful pleasures are second-nature to rakish Valmont. Lie, cheat, deceive, debauch, double-cross, betray. But do not fall in love. The story comes from the frequently banned 1782 novel “Les Liaisons Dangereuses” written by Choderlos De Laclos, and was transformed into an international stage success by Christopher Hampton who then fashioned the play into an Oscar winning movie script. The luxurious setting is pre-French Revolution, but the characters could step into the dog-eat-dog nineties without skipping a beat.

results.title: Dangerous immigrant
results.brief_description: Points out the danger of the chance introduction into Australia - in prefabricated houses and packing cases imported from overseas - of the European house borer, Hylotrupes bajulus. The life history of the pest and methods of detecting and eradicating it are treated in detail.

results.title: Dangerous ground
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Darrell Roodt, Gillian Gorfil and Ice Cube
results.brief_description: After being in exile and living in America for the last 14 years, Vusi Madlazi (Ice Cube) returns to South Africa for his father’s funeral and discovers that South Africa has fallen into the hands of drug baron’s and gang violence. Following his father’s funeral, Vusi’s mother informs him that his brother Steven is missing, feared to be in trouble with one of the major drug baron’s‘s, Muki (Ving Rhames). Along with his girlfriend, Karin (Elizabeth Hurley), Vusi sets out to find his brother in Johannesburg. Together, they discover Stephen has become addicted to crack, owes Muki $45,000 and the debt needs to be paid or else Vusi will end up burying his brother as well.

results.title: Dangerous game (Ferrara)
results.creator_credit: Maverick, Mary Kane and Abel Ferrara
results.brief_description: ‘Dangerous Game’ is a film about film. Eddie Israel (Keitel) is a director on a shoot in L.A.. His film depicts the extreme emotions and escalating violence of a married couple at a destructive crossroad and departure point in their relationship. Reality blurs when the actors Sarah Jenning (played by Madonna) and Francis Burns (James Russo) increasingly begin to live the lives of their characters, as the demands of their roles intensify, corrupting their own sensibilities. A fissure in Israel’s middleclass suburban N.Y. life is opened and the rot sets in when he allows the film to become the vehicle for his own frustrations. As much about film as being one, ‘Dangerous Game’ borrows inspiration from Cassavettes and turns the film around to reflect itself. Although the film focuses on Israel’s desire to see the actors plumb the depths of the emotion in their roles, ‘Dangerous Game’ becomes more of a comment on what is lost during the process. This is supported by a sequence in the film from Blank’s documentary ‘Burden of Dreams’, featuring an interview with Werner Herzog on shoot for ‘Fitzcarraldo’.

results.title: Dangerous game
results.creator_credit: Quantum Films, Virgo Productions, Judith West, Basil Appleby and Stephen Hopkins
results.brief_description: Dangerous game is director Stephen Hopkins’ debut feature film but he is better known for his later features “Nightmare on Elm Street 5”, “Predator 2”, “Lost in space”, “Blown away” and several TV productions, including “24”. This Australian thriller, set in Sydney, centres around a group of five uni students, David (Miles Buchanan), Jack (Marcus Graham), Tony (John Polson), Kathryn (Kathryn Walker) and Ziggy (Sandie Lillingston) whose lives are suddenly turned upside down when they decide on a whim, late one night, to break into a department store - just for the sheer thrill of it all. What they were unprepared for, however, was the presence of Murphy (Steven Grives) the psycho cop who had, for reasons of his own, taken to stalking and harrassing Jack, pursuing him in a menacing, almost fanatical, manner to such a point that he lost his job that very day through Jack reporting him. Now Murphy is the security guard in the department store and he wants revenge. From a fairly slow start, the film gradually builds up into an action thriller with some tense moments and unexpected outcomes. Based on an original script by Michael Ralph, screenplay by Peter West and cinematography by Peter Levy.

results.title: Dangerous creatures (PC)
results.brief_description: Welcome to the interactive world of dangerous creatures! You’ll be amazed as you discover the truth - and the extraordinary myths - about these intriguing creatures. ‘Dangerous creatures’ comes with an overview movie that teaches you the basics of using the program. The first time you start the program, you’ll be given the opportunity to see the overview. You can also choose to see the overview whenever you like. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC that includes a 386SX or higher, at least 4MB of RAM, 2.5MB of available hard disk space, CD-ROM drive, audio board and VGA or VGA+. MS DOS and Microsoft Windows operating system version 3.1 or later.

results.title: Dangerous charter
results.creator_credit: Gold Key Entertainment, Robert Gottschalk and John Moore
results.brief_description: Three bluefin fishermen going about their daily routine find a luxury yacht, ‘Medusa’ drifting on the sea and decide to board her. Finding a dead body and no one else there, shipmates Marty, Kick and Joe see dollar signs appearing before their eyes and agree to salvage it. On dry land the F.B.I and coast guard are intrigued by the mysterious vessel. Marty and co. are allowed to keep the yacht on one condition- that they are used as fish bait to catch the owner of the vessel, a man believed to be a wealthy criminal involved in narcotics. The bait is taken and the drama begins. With corny humour and some bad acting, one could think the film may not stay afloat, however the well paced story line seems to keep the movie moving along enjoyably. Cast includes Chris Warfield, Sally Fraser and Richard Foote.
